title: Print, "Chandelier d'Eglise (Church Chandelier), plate 81, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)", 1695–1750
signed: Signed in plate, lower left: J. A. Meissonnier inv.; lower right: Huquier Sculp ex et S. Jacq. CPR.
inscribed: Inscribed in plate, upper left: N; upper right: 81; lower center: Chandelier d'Eglise
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Footed lamp in rococo style; main body shows cross with what look like rays. Above, two putti heads gaze downward; above, lamp is in a roughly triangular shape, made up of C-curves leading upward to a bowl-like element topped with a point.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Chandelier d'Eglise (Church Chandelier), plate 81, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)", 1695–1750.
1695–1750. Engraving on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-212-39.
